abstract: Although the giant retailer reported a rise in profit, its same-store sales in the United States declined for the sixth consecutive quarter.
snippet: Although the giant retailer reported a rise in profit, its same-store sales in the United States declined for the sixth consecutive quarter.
lead_paragraph: The tepid economic recovery does not seem to be extending to many of Wal-Mart’s customers in the United States, lower-income consumers who are not yet spending. The nation’s largest retailer reported Tuesday that sales in its American stores open at least a year, a crucial measure of retail health, had declined for the sixth consecutive quarter.
